alerts.alert: Content Security Policy (CSP) Header Not Set
alerts.solution: Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to set the Content-Security-Policy header.
alerts.description: Content Security Policy (CSP) is an added layer of security that helps to detect and mitigate certain types of attacks, including Cross Site Scripting (XSS) and data injection attacks.

alerts.solution: Modern Web browsers support the Content-Security-Policy and X-Frame-Options HTTP headers. Ensure one of them is set on all web pages returned by your site.
alerts.description: The response does not include either Content-Security-Policy with 'frame-ancestors' directive or X-Frame-Options to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.

alerts.alert: Server Leaks Information via 'X-Powered-By' HTTP Response Header Field(s)
alerts.solution: Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress 'X-Powered-By' headers.
alerts.description: The web/application server is leaking information via one or more 'X-Powered-By' HTTP response headers.

alerts.solution: Remove all comments that return information that may help an attacker and fix any underlying problems they refer to.
alerts.description: The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker.
